fields.summary: RV: Detail View - do not show comment field if empty

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a JIRA Administrator,
I want to have the colours that I customized on the Cumulative Flow Diagram in the Chart Board show up in the dashboard gadgets,
So that the team can tell what the colours mean and have a seamless Cumulative Flow experience.

Repro:
# Customize your Greenhopper Cumulative Flow colours by click the colours in the legend and setting them (see attached).
# Add a cumulative flow gadget to your dashboard

Expected:
Colours follow what you just set up on the chard board.

Actual:
Colours are some weird, random, hard to fathom set of default colours.
fields.summary: Use Custom Cumulative Flow Colours on Cumulative Flow Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello!

The behaviour is kinda easy to reproduce:
- go to Planning Board
- have more than 1 page of cards (so the '1', '2' links appears on the left top corner of the planning board window);
- Drag a card, and mouse over one of the other pages: A new small window will appear containing a list of all cards of a given page.
- Try to drop the card on the after the last card of that page (on the down-left part of the small window).

If the steps above are done, the card will remain on the page that it belongs, and won't change pages. Is it supposed to be like this?

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Drag and Drop on Planning board to last position don't work as expected with multiple pages

fields.description:
Currently the fixVersion synchronizer will run when triggered by the following JIRA events:

* Issue Created
* Issue Reopened
* Issue Moved
* Issue Updated

If a user wants to use a custom event in their workflow, then they won't be able to trigger these synchronizers as part of that workflow, without using one of these events, and as the workflows only allow one event to be triggered, users are stuck with the choice of using one feature or another.

If we could allow the synchronizer listeners to be triggered by user-configurable events, then users could have their cake and eat it too.
fields.summary: Allow FixVersion Synchronizer listener to be triggered by custom events

fields.description:
There is a known issue noted in the documentation here: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH043/Viewing+the+Hour+Burndown+Chart] - also see image attached.
I believe the issue is simply that any work logged (new or update to existing) is represented on the hour burndown chart on the actual day that the work was entered (i.e. not on the date entered in the log work dialogue box).
Please will you change the hour burndown so the representation of actual work is driven from the 'Date started'  field on the log work dialogue.  Without this fix we have no flexibility on entering work retrospectively.  Thank you.

fields.description:
This was brought to my attention recently that in one of our iterations where a story that had been moved (slipped) to a future release, the incomplete story still showed up in the previous iteration backlog when viewed in the GH Project Progress Gadget.

!project progress gadget.png|thumbnail!

*JQL Filter Results*

When we click on the chart to bring up the 'To Do' item, the filter results show the remaining issue is actually part of iteration 182 and not 181. It seems as if the Project Progress Gadget then is incorrectly including 'Release Version History' as part of the JQL to generate the chart for an 'Unreleased Version'. This doesn't seem right and as a result the iteration shows there is still work to be done when there isn't.

!jql_results.png|thumbnail!
Our end users are confused because the iteration backlog looks as if it has unplayed stories for that version, when really they are 
unplayed for a future iteration. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
It should be easy to replicate. 
1. Create several stories (i.e. 4)
2. Place them into an unreleased version (Version 182).
3. Mark all but one of the stories as 'Done'. 
4. Move the remaining incomplete story to a different unreleased version (Version 182) 
5. Add a GreenHopper Project Progress Gadget to your dashboard for Version 182.
6. You should see 1 item marked 'To Do' for that version.
7. Click on gadget to view 'To Do' item in issue filter results.
Note the JQL filter query criteria and that it includes the story from Version 182 and includes 'Released Version History' when version has not been released.

What should happen.
I shouldn't see issues that once appeared in the version for unreleased versions. Sprint 181 should not contain data from 182 in the project progress gadget.
fields.summary: Greenhopper Project Progress Gadget incorrectly includes issues from released version history when displaying unreleased version project progress

fields.description: When our team works in a sprint there are quite a few stories and tasks on the board where they are working on. When we discuss the status of the stories, we feel it is easier to give the stories and tasks a number (for example story 5, task 5.1). It is easier to use a number to refer to a task then use the full text. The stories and tasks do have a JIRA ticket that we can use for identification, but the number is too long, and there is no real sequence. Our tickets have the id: FIN-4567, FIN-4568 etc. Using these numbers do not work as well, since you can't remember so much tickets. So for the easy of identifying tickets I am looking for a field that I can use to put the numbers 5, 5.1, 55.2 etc in.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to give stories their own unique ID rather then just a Jira ticket number for identifications.

fields.description:
When tickets are added (or removed) in the middle of an iteration, the change should show up on the charts on the day it was made. Right now, the story points are changed on the first day in the chart.

For example, say a sprint started on April 1 with 50 points. Suppose a 3-point story is closed on April 2 and a 5-point story is added on April 3. The story point burndown should show the following:
April 1 - 50 points
April 2 - 47 points
April 3 - 52 points

Right now the above example results in the following chart:
April 1 - 55 points
April 2 - 52 points
April 3 - 52 points

This doesn't reflect reality! Based on standard scrum principles, You should be able to change the burndown for days in the past.

The Issue Burndown Chart should also work this way.
fields.summary: As a ScrumMaster, when I add or remove tickets from a sprint (version), I would like to see the chart values updated for the day the change was made so that I can accurately reflect on what happened in the sprint.

fields.description:
The GreenHopper plugin should support time management without requiring work to be logged. This is a common Scrum practice and has resulted in the time management feature being modified recently in JIRA 4.2.

Explanation:
With GreenHopper, I may presently add the field "Remaining" to the Card View. This field, however, is calculated and requires that the "Time Spent" be entered in order to perform the calculation. Many practitioners of Scrum specifically avoid tracking "Time Spent" and focus strictly on how much time is required to complete work on a story. This is useful where one is more interested in looking forward and not so much in looking backward.

In JIRA 4.2 one may directly enter a value for "Remaining Estimate" without entering a value for "Time Spent". This cannot presently be done directly on the Card View (in the Planning Board) as the field "Remaining Estimate" cannot be added to this view. This forces one to "View the issue in JIRA" and then "Edit the issue in JIRA" in order to update the value for "Remaining Estimate" and then close both of these to return to the Planning Board and then see the updated value in the "Remaining" field. Ouch!

From the JIRA 4.2 Release Notes:

Time Tracking Changes

Prior to JIRA 4.2, the Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate fields could not be edited independently and their values would be synchronised after logging work.

From JIRA 4.2, time tracking is more flexible. The values in these fields are not tied to each other and they can be edited independently. Additionally, it is now possible to change the Original Estimate value after work has been logged.


References: 
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-13733 
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.2+Release+Notes
fields.summary: Please allow for the "editable" Remaining Estimate field to be added to a card on the Planning Board (now available since JIRA 4.2)

It's not possible to disable and re-enable the GH plugin in UPM atm. The problem is that the _com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.timetracking.WorklogHistoryCacheImpl_ doesn't clean up its registered cache on disposal. It should implement _org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean_ and call _cacheManager.removeCache(CACHE_NAME)_ (watch out for ISE) or check for _net.sf.ehcache.CacheManager.cacheExists(String)_ on _afterPropertiesSet_.
fields.summary: WorklogHistoryCacheImpl doesn't remove cache registration on disposal

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. open the Planning Board
2. select a release and a context with no stories/tasks added yet
3. add a new story
4. add tasks to the story
5. add original estimates to the tasks as you add them
6. open the Task Board
7. move tasks into progress
8. use the Log Work function to add Time Spent to tasks
9. switch back to the Planning Board
10. observe the hours on the Statistics display
11. open the Chart board

Observed Result:
The Time Estimate field is always set to zero. The Chart Board shows a horizontal line across the bottom with all zeros for the original estimates. 

Expected Result:
The Original Estimate field should reflect the total number of hours added to each task. The Chart board should reflect the hours worked and the hours remaining against the original estimates. 

Attachments:
PB1.jpg - planning board statistics after initial task creation
PB2.jpg - planning board statistics after putting a 10 hour task into progress and logging 5 hours on it
PB3.jpg - planning board statistics after putting a 4 hour task into progress and logging all 4 hours on it
CorrectHours.jpg - chart showing what the correct hours should be on the planning board after each event
ChartBoard.jpg - chart board after logging 5 hours on a 10 hour task and 4 hours on a 4 hour task

NOTE: We are also seeing issues with the Original Estimate field for existing releases/contexts where stories/tasks were brought over from previous sprints having completely incorrect values in the Time Estimate field (sometimes over by hundreds of hours).
fields.summary: Hours are not updating correctly on Planning Board Statistics display corrupting the Hours Burndown Chart

issue type. Add to issue default issue screen.
2. Set the default value to any user group.
3. Set Notification to be sent to the user group when issue is created.
4. Go to Agile - Planning Board and add this custom field to the Card view.
5. Now click on New Card
6. The default group that appears in the custom field is enclosed within
square brackets. Because of this square brackets, the mail notification is
not sent our to the members of the group. If you remove the square brackets
and then add the new card then the mail gets sent out.
7. Note, this issue is not seen when you add an issue from the issue detail
screen.
fields.summary: Group Picker Custom Field is being populated with brackets for the default group set, hence it isn't sending notifications
